translated: Volume 5 of the Comprehensive Records of the Generations of Buddhas and Patriarchs
Dazhong Xiangfu Chan Monastery in Jiaxing Prefecture
Collected by Huating Nianchang

original: 東漢丙子　章帝炟改建初一名坦。
analyzed: 東漢丙子　章帝炟改建初一名坦。
translated: In the third year of the Biaozi era of the Eastern Han, Emperor Zhang changed the name to Jianchu, also known as Tan.
The fifth son of Emperor Ming.
He ascended the throne at the age of nineteen.
In the first month of the Wuzi year, he passed away at the Zhangde Hall.
He lived to the age of thirty-one.
He was buried in Jing Mausoleum. He ruled for thirteen years.

original: 庚辰　帝命鄭玄等諸生作白虎通。🔽甲申　改元和徐州刺史王景上。🔽金人頌美。
analyzed: 庚辰　帝命鄭玄等諸生作白虎通。 甲申　改元和徐州刺史王景上。 金人頌美。
translated: In the gengchen year, the emperor ordered Zheng Xuan and other scholars to compile the Baihu Tong.
In the jiashen year, he changed the name to Yuanhe. Wang Jing, the governor of Xuzhou, presented a eulogy praising the merits of the previous emperor in introducing Buddhism.

original: 載漢書○有神雀鳳皇白鹿白烏之瑞。
analyzed: 載漢書○有神雀鳳皇白鹿白烏之瑞。
translated: It is recorded in the History of the Han Dynasty. There were auspicious signs such as a divine sparrow, phoenix, white deer, and white crow.
In the dinghai year, he changed the name to Zhanghe.

original: 己丑　和帝肇改永元章第四子。
analyzed: 己丑　和帝肇改永元章第四子。
translated: In the jiaxu year, Emperor He changed the name to Yongyuan. The fourth son of Zhang.
He ascended the throne at the age of ten.
In the second year of the bisi year, he passed away at the Zhangde Front Hall.
He lived to the age of twenty-seven.
He was buried in Shen Mausoleum. He reigned for seventeen years.
Yi Si: Changed the era name to Yuanxing.

original: 丙午　殤帝隆改延平和之少子。
analyzed: 丙午　殤帝隆改延平和之少子。
translated: Bing Wu: Emperor Shang, the son of Emperor He, changed the era name to Yonghe.
He was born more than a hundred days.

original: 即位于元興元年十二月。
analyzed: 即位于元興元年十二月。
translated: He ascended the throne in the twelfth month of the first year of Yuanxing.
At that time, Empress Deng took charge of the court.
The following year, in the eighth month, he died in the Chongde Front Hall.
He lived for two years.
He was buried in Kang Mausoleum, reigning for one year.

original: 一　丁未　安帝祐改永初章帝孫清河孝王慶之子。
analyzed: 一　丁未　安帝祐改永初章帝孫清河孝王慶之子。
translated: Ding Wei: Emperor An, the grandson of Emperor Zhang, the son of King Xiao of Qinghe.
At the age of thirteen, he ascended the throne.
In the second month of Yi Chou, he went on a southern tour.
He went to Ye.
He died in the carriage.
He lived for thirty-two years.
He was buried in Gong Mausoleum, reigning for nineteen years.
Jia Yin: Changed the era name to Yuanchu.

original: 二　丁巳　第二十一祖婆脩盤頭者。
analyzed: 二　丁巳　第二十一祖婆脩盤頭者。
translated: Ding Si: The twenty-first patriarch, Bhadrapada.
He was from Rajagrha.
His surname was Vaisya.🔽His father was Guang Gai.
His mother was Yan Yi.
The family was wealthy but had no children.

original: 父母禱于佛塔而求嗣焉。
analyzed: 父母禱于佛塔而求嗣焉。
translated: The parents prayed at the Buddha's pagoda for a child.
One night the mother dreamed of swallowing two luminous pearls.
After waking, she became pregnant.
After seven days, there was an arhat
named Xianzhong.
He came to the family.
Guanggao set up a canopy and made offerings.
Xianzhong sat upright and accepted them.
Yan came out to pay respects.
Xianzhong moved aside and said,
I should return the courtesy to a great being with a Dharma body.
Guanggao did not understand the reason.
So he took a precious pearl
and knelt to offer it to Xianzhong.
To test its authenticity.
Xianzhong immediately accepted it.
Without any humility or thanks. Guanggao could not bear it.
He asked,
I am a man.
You do not return my respects.
What merit does my wife have?
Why does the Venerable avoid her?

analyzed: 賢眾曰。 我受禮納珠。
translated: Xianzhong said,🔽I accept your respects and take the pearl.
It is to bless you.
Your wife is carrying a holy child.
When born, he will be a lamp for the world, a sun of wisdom.
Therefore, I avoid it.
It is not because I despise women.
The wise assembly also said,
Your wife will give birth to two sons.
The first will be named Vṛjiputra.
He will be the one I revere.

original: 二名芻尼此云野鵲子昔如來在雪山修道。
analyzed: 二名芻尼此云野鵲子昔如來在雪山修道。
translated: The second will be named Śreṇika (meaning 'crow's son'). In the past, when the Tathāgata was cultivating the Way in the Snow Mountains,
Śreṇika built a nest on his head.
After the Buddha attained enlightenment,
Śreṇika received the reward of becoming the king of the country of Nādikā.
The Buddha prophesied,
In the second five hundred years,
you will be born in the Vaiśākha family in the city of Rājagṛha.
You will be a fellow disciple with the sage.
This is not false.
After one month, two sons were indeed born.
The Venerable Vṛjiputra,
when he reached the age of fifteen,
paid homage to the Arhat Guptata and left home to become a monk.

original: 感毘婆訶菩薩與之授戒。
analyzed: 感毘婆訶菩薩與之授戒。
translated: He was inspired by the Bodhisattva Vipaśyin to give him the precepts.
He traveled to the country of Nādikā to spread the Dharma.
The king of that country was named Sthiraśraddhā.
He had two sons.
The first was named Mahalla.
The next one was called Manjushrimitra.
The king asked the Venerable One, saying:
How is the local custom of Rajagrha the same or different from here?
The Venerable One said:
In that country, three Buddhas have appeared in the world.
Now in your country, there are two teachers guiding and transforming.
He said, Who are the two teachers?
The Venerable One said:

original: 佛記第二五百年有一神力大士出家繼聖。
analyzed: 佛記第二五百年有一神力大士出家繼聖。
translated: The Buddha predicted that in the second five hundred years, a great being with spiritual powers would leave the household life and succeed the Sage.

original: 即王之次子摩拏羅是其一也。
analyzed: 即王之次子摩拏羅是其一也。
translated: He is none other than your second son, Manjushrimitra.
Although I am of meager virtue, I dare to be one of them.
The king said:
Indeed, as the Venerable One has said,
I will give up this son to become a monk.
The Venerable One said:
Excellent, Great King!
You are able to follow the Buddha's will.
He then conferred the precepts and transmitted the Dharma.
The verse says:
Bubbles and illusions are the same without obstruction.

original: 如何不了悟達法在其中。
analyzed: 如何不了悟達法在其中。
translated: How can one not understand and realize that the Dharma is within?
It is neither of the present nor of the past.
After the Venerable One transmitted the Dharma,
he rose into the air to a height of half a yojana.
He stood upright.
The four assemblies looked up at him with reverence and requested him.
He sat in full lotus position again and passed away.
After cremation, śarīra were obtained and a stūpa was built.

original: 當後漢安帝十一年丁巳歲也。
analyzed: 當後漢安帝十一年丁巳歲也。
translated: This was in the 11th year of Emperor An's reign of the Later Han Dynasty, the Dingsi year.

original: 庚申　改永寧。🔽辛酉　改建光。
analyzed: 庚申　改永寧。 辛酉　改建光。
translated: Gengshen: Changed to Yongning.🔽Xinyu: Changed to Jinguang.
Renxu: Changed to Yanguang.

original: 甲子　四七　王十八年也。🔽丙寅　北鄉侯懿章帝孫。
analyzed: 甲子　四七　王十八年也。 丙寅　北鄉侯懿章帝孫。
translated: Jiazi: The 47th year, the 18th year of King Jing of Chu.🔽Bingyin: Prince of Beihu, grandson of Emperor Yi Zhang.
Son of King Jibei Shou.
Empress Dowager Yan established him.
He ascended the throne in the 3rd month of this year.
He passed away in the 10th month.
He ruled for 272 days.
Emperor Shun, changed to Yongjian, son of Emperor An.

original: 年十一登位梁商父子秉政。
analyzed: 年十一登位梁商父子秉政。
translated: At the age of 11, he ascended the throne. Liang Shang and his son held power.
In the 8th month of Jiachen, he died in the front hall of Yutang.
He lived to the age of 30.
He was buried at Xianling.

original: 永寧初為太子在位十九年。
analyzed: 永寧初為太子在位十九年。
translated: In the beginning of Yongning, he was the crown prince for 19 years.
Renchen: Changed to Yangjia.
Biaozi: Changed to Yonghe.

original: 壬午　改漢安。🔽甲申　改建康。
analyzed: 壬午　改漢安。 甲申　改建康。
translated: Renwu: Changed to Han'an.🔽Jiachen: Changed to Jiankang.

original: 乙酉　冲帝炳改永嘉順帝子。
analyzed: 乙酉　冲帝炳改永嘉順帝子。
translated: Yiyin: Emperor Chong, named Bing, changed to Yongjia, son of Emperor Shun.
His mother was Lady Yu of the imperial harem.
He ascended the throne in the eighth month of Jiachen in Jiankang.
At that time, he was two years old.
Empress Dowager Liang took charge of the court.
Liang Ji assisted in governing.

original: 次年三月而崩玉堂前殿。
analyzed: 次年三月而崩玉堂前殿。
translated: The following year, in the third month, he died in the Jade Hall in front of the palace.
He lived for three years.
He was buried in Huai Mausoleum. His reign lasted one year.

original: 丙戌　質帝纘改本初章帝玄孫。
analyzed: 丙戌　質帝纘改本初章帝玄孫。
translated: Bingxu: Emperor Zhi succeeded and changed to Benchu. He was a great-grandson of Emperor Zhang.
He was the son of Prince Bohai Hong.
He ascended the throne at the age of eight.
He was intelligent and accomplished from an early age.
Once, on the day of the court assembly,
Liang Ji said, The general is domineering.
Ji disliked this.
He poisoned him in the Jade Hall in front of the palace.

original: 壽九歲葬靜陵在位一年。
analyzed: 壽九歲葬靜陵在位一年。
translated: He lived for nine years and was buried in Jing Mausoleum. His reign lasted one year.

original: 三　丁亥　桓帝志改建和章帝曾孫。
analyzed: 三　丁亥　桓帝志改建和章帝曾孫。
translated: Dinghai: Emperor Huan, named Zhi, changed to Jianhe. He was a great-grandson of Emperor Zhang.
Li was the son of Hou Yi.
He ascended the throne at fifteen.
Liang Ji assisted in government.

original: 永康丁未崩于德陽前殿。
analyzed: 永康丁未崩于德陽前殿。
translated: He died in the front hall of Deyang on the dingwei day of the third month in the Yongkang era.
He was thirty-six years old.

original: 葬宣陵也在位二十一年。
analyzed: 葬宣陵也在位二十一年。
translated: He was buried in Xuanling. He reigned for twenty-one years.

original: 四　己丑　安息國沙門。
analyzed: 四　己丑　安息國沙門。
translated: Fourth, in the jiaxu year, the monk from the state of Arsakes.
An Qing, whose courtesy name was Shigao.
He was originally the crown prince and should have succeeded to the throne.
He abdicated to his uncle and left the country to become a monk.

original: 既至洛京譯經二十九部。
analyzed: 既至洛京譯經二十九部。
translated: After arriving in Luoyang, he translated twenty-nine scriptures.
In one hundred and seventy-six fascicles.
He finished translating in the third year of Jianning of Emperor Ling of the Han Dynasty.

original: 因附舟浮游次廬山之䢼亭廟。
analyzed: 因附舟浮游次廬山之䢼亭廟。
translated: He then boarded a boat and drifted to the temple of Qu Ting on Mount Lu.
The boat was moored under the temple. The temple god was very spiritual.
He could send winds to escort boats coming and going.
There was someone who asked for bamboo from the god.
He did not give permission, but the bamboo was cut down.
The god became angry, overturned his boat, and brought the cut bamboo to the place where it was cut.
Those who passed by trembled with sweat.
Gao's boatman offered sacrifices and asked for blessings.
The spirit immediately descended and said:
There is a śramaṇa on the boat.
Why did he not come with me?

original: 高至廟下神復降與高語奮。
analyzed: 高至廟下神復降與高語奮。
translated: When Gao arrived at the temple, the spirit descended again and spoke with Gao.
Then it wept and said:
I live in this lake.
For a thousand miles, all is under my control.
Because of my many past resentments, I now have an extremely ugly form.
Moreover, I will die soon and will certainly enter hell.
I have a thousand bolts of silk and various precious toys.
Please build a temple and pagoda for me as a means of spiritual merit.
Gao agreed.
Xu said:
Can you show your form? I am curious.
The spirit said:
My form is ugly, what's the point?
Gao said:
Just show it.
Then it brought out its head from the curtain.
It was a giant python.
Gao chanted a Sanskrit spell over it.
The python seemed to shed tears and suddenly disappeared.
Before the boat departed,
a young man knelt in front.
Gao chanted a spell over him and he left.
The boatmen asked who he was.
Gao said:🔽He is the son of the spirit of the lake.
The temple deity has already escaped the form of a python.
Therefore, he came to express his gratitude.
Gao arrived in Yuzhang and built a temple.
This is the present Dayan Temple.

original: 由高而名蓋江淮寺塔之始。
analyzed: 由高而名蓋江淮寺塔之始。
translated: The name is derived from Gao. It is the beginning of temples and pagodas in the Jiang Huai region.
Gengyin year, changed to Heiping.

original: 是年月支國沙門支婁迦讖。
analyzed: 是年月支國沙門支婁迦讖。
translated: In this year, the Indian monk Zhi Lou Jiachen.
Also called Zhi Chan.
Arrived in Luoyang.
After a short time, he learned the language and became fluent in Chinese.
He then translated scriptures.
By the Zhongping years, he had translated 21 texts.
In 63 scrolls.

original: 永興元年桓帝於宮中鑄黃金浮圖老子像。
analyzed: 永興元年桓帝於宮中鑄黃金浮圖老子像。
translated: In the first year of Yongxing, Emperor Huan cast a golden floating tower and Laozi image in the palace.
Covered it with a hundred treasure flower canopy.
Personally worshiped it.
As a result, the people were converted.
The worship of the Buddha became even more prevalent.
Xinmao year, changed to Yuanjia.

original: 世尊示滅一千一百年矣。🔽癸巳　改永興。🔽乙未　改永壽。
analyzed: 世尊示滅一千一百年矣。 癸巳　改永興。 乙未　改永壽。
translated: It has been 1,100 years since the World-Honored One's nirvana.🔽Gui Si year, changed to Yongxing.🔽Bingwei year, changed to Yongshou.
Wuxu year, changed to Yanhui.

original: 五　乙巳　第二十二祖摩拏羅者。
analyzed: 五　乙巳　第二十二祖摩拏羅者。
translated: 5. Euthymic Year, the twenty-second patriarch, Manjushri.

original: 那提國常自在王之子也。
analyzed: 那提國常自在王之子也。
translated: 5. Euthymic Year, the 22nd year. The 22nd Patriarch, Manjushri, was the son of King Chang-tzu-tsai of the country of Nati.
At the age of thirty, he met Patriarch Vasubandhu.
He left home and transmitted the Dharma to Western India.
The king of that country was named De-du.
He was of the Gautama clan.
He took refuge in the Buddha's teachings and diligently practiced with vigor.

original: 一日於行道處現一小塔。
analyzed: 一日於行道處現一小塔。
translated: One day, a small stupa appeared in the place where he was walking.
He wanted to take it for worship, but no one could lift it.

original: 王即大會梵行禪觀咒術等三眾。
analyzed: 王即大會梵行禪觀咒術等三眾。
translated: The king then gathered the three groups of Brahmins, practitioners of meditation, and spell casters.
He wanted to ask about his doubts.
At that time, the Venerable One also attended this assembly.
None of the three groups could discern it.

original: 尊者即為王廣說塔之所因阿育王造塔此不繁錄今之出現。
analyzed: 尊者即為王廣說塔之所因阿育王造塔此不繁錄今之出現。
translated: The Venerable One then explained in detail the reason for the stupa's appearance, that it was built by King Asoka, and recorded it here without elaboration.
It is due to the king's meritorious power that it has appeared.
When the king heard this,
he said,
A true sage is difficult to encounter, and worldly pleasures are not lasting.
He then passed the throne to his crown prince.
He then left home to become a monk under the Venerable.

original: 七日而證四果。🔽尊者深加慰誨。
analyzed: 七日而證四果。 尊者深加慰誨。
translated: After seven days, he attained the four fruits.
The Venerable greatly rejoiced and instructed him, saying, You should stay in this country and liberate people on your own.
Now in a different land there is a great vessel of the Dharma.
I will transform him and enable him to attain liberation.

original: 曰師應迹十方動念當至。
analyzed: 曰師應迹十方動念當至。
translated: He said, The Master can manifest in the ten directions and arrive instantly with a thought.
Is it necessary to go there?
The Venerable said, Yes.

original: 於是焚香遙語月氏國鶴勒那比丘曰。
analyzed: 於是焚香遙語月氏國鶴勒那比丘曰。
translated: Then he burned incense and spoke from afar to the bhikṣu Kūṭa-dāna in the country of the Yuezhi, saying,
You are teaching the flock of cranes in that country.
The fruit of the Way is about to be realized, so you should be aware of it yourself.

original: 時鶴勒那為彼國王寶印說脩多羅偈。
analyzed: 時鶴勒那為彼國王寶印說脩多羅偈。
translated: At that time, Kūṭa-dāna was expounding the sūtras and verses to King Ratnasikhin of that country.
Suddenly he saw a cluster of strange fragrances.
The king said,
What is this auspicious sign?

original: 曰此是西印度傳佛心印祖師摩拏羅將至。
analyzed: 曰此是西印度傳佛心印祖師摩拏羅將至。
translated: He said, This is the patriarch Mañjuśrī of West India, who will transmit the Buddha's mind seal.
He has first sent the fragrant sign of faith.
The king said, What kind of spiritual power does this master have?
He replied,
This master has received the Buddha's prophecy from afar.
He will widely spread the profound teachings in this land.

original: 時王與鶴勒那俱遙作禮。
analyzed: 時王與鶴勒那俱遙作禮。
translated: At that time, the king and Halaśānanda made prostrations from afar.

original: 尊者知已即辭得度比丘往月氏國。
analyzed: 尊者知已即辭得度比丘往月氏國。
translated: The Venerable One, knowing this, took leave and went with the monk who had attained liberation to the country of Yuezhi.
He accepted the offerings of the king and Halaśānanda.
Later, Halaśānanda asked the Venerable One, saying:

original: 我止林間已經九白印土以一年為一白有弟子龍子者。
analyzed: 我止林間已經九白印土以一年為一白有弟子龍子者。
translated: I have been staying in the forest for nine years. In India, one year is called one white. I have a disciple named Dragon Son.
He is young but intelligent.

original: 我於三世推窮莫知其本。
analyzed: 我於三世推窮莫知其本。
translated: I have searched through the three periods of time but cannot know his origin.
The Venerable One said:
This child, in the fifth kalpa,
was born in the family of a brahman in the country of Wonderful Joy.

original: 曾以旃檀施於佛宇作槌撞鐘。
analyzed: 曾以旃檀施於佛宇作槌撞鐘。
translated: He once offered sandalwood to the Buddha's abode and made a bell with it.
He received the reward of being intelligent and admired by the masses.
He asked again:
What conditions do I have that cause me to be surrounded by a flock of cranes?
The Venerable One said:
In your fourth kalpa,
you were once a bhikṣu.
You were about to go to a meeting in the palace of the nāgas.
All your disciples wanted to follow you.

original: 汝觀五百眾中無有一人堪任妙供。
analyzed: 汝觀五百眾中無有一人堪任妙供。
translated: You see that among the five hundred disciples, there is not a single one worthy of receiving such wonderful offerings.

analyzed: 時諸子曰。 師常說法。
translated: The disciples said,
The teacher always said that the Dharma is equal, and so should be the offerings.
If this is not so,
how can it be considered holy?
You should go to the assembly yourself.

original: 自汝捨生趣生轉化諸國。
analyzed: 自汝捨生趣生轉化諸國。
translated: Since you left home, you have been reborn and transformed in various countries.

original: 其五百弟子以福微德薄生於羽族。
analyzed: 其五百弟子以福微德薄生於羽族。
translated: The five hundred disciples, due to their meager blessings and virtue, were reborn among the feathered race.
Now, they are moved by your kindness.
Therefore, as a flock of cranes, they follow you.
Hekṣaṇa heard these words and said,
By what expedient means can I liberate them?
The Venerable One said,
I have the unsurpassed Dharma treasure.
You should listen and accept it, transforming for the sake of future generations.
And he spoke a verse:
The mind follows myriad phenomena, turning.
Where it turns is truly profound.
Following the flow, one recognizes the nature.
There is no joy, and no sorrow.
When the flock of cranes heard the verse, they flew away, crying.
The Venerable One sat in meditation, and suddenly passed away.
Kṣudra-deva and King Ratnapātra built stupas.

original: 當後漢桓帝十九年乙巳歲也。🔽丁未　改永康。
analyzed: 當後漢桓帝十九年乙巳歲也。 丁未　改永康。
translated: This was in the 19th year of Emperor Huan of the Later Han, the 2nd year of the Yi Si cycle.
In the 2nd year of the Yong Kang era, the great teaching reached the Eastern Xia for 100 years.

original: 六　戊申　靈帝宏改建寧章帝玄孫。
analyzed: 六　戊申　靈帝宏改建寧章帝玄孫。
translated: In the 5th year of the Yong Kang era, Emperor Ling of the Han changed the era name to Jian Ning. He was a great-grandson of Emperor Zhang.
He was the son of Duke Du Ting Hou Chang.
He ascended the throne at the age of 12.
